seo.title_override: Phoenix AZ Mattress Disposal Guide 2026 | Legal & Easy
seo.meta_desc_override: Phoenix, AZ mattress disposal can be tricky. Avoid fines up to $2,500! Discover legal options, including convenient curbside pickup, to properly dispose of your old mattress.

hero_hook: Struggling with old mattress disposal in Phoenix? Avoid hefty fines and the desert heat with our easy guide.
neighborhoods: Ahwatukee Foothills, Alhambra, Arcadia, Biltmore, Camelback East, Deer Valley, Desert Ridge, Downtown Phoenix, Encanto, Estrella Village, Laveen, Maryvale, North Mountain, Paradise Valley Village, South Mountain

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: Materials such as furniture, small appliances, toilets, and large amounts of vegetation are often considered bulk trash.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Make an appointment before setting out your bulk item. Have your items placed by 5:30 a.m. on your scheduled appointment date. Make sure you have your appointment scheduled before you begin placing your bulk items at the curb (no more than 7 days ahead of your scheduled date). It is a violation of city ordinance to place trash out more than 7 days before your scheduled appointment.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Set bulk items out in a single pile no larger than ten (10) cubic yards per residence​ (all material should be placed no more than 5 feet from the street/curb or front edge of the property). Don't Include:​ ​More than ten (10) cubic yards of bulk trash per residence. Cut tree trimmings down to less than 12 inches in diameter and 4 feet in length​. More than 2 wooden pallets. Construction or demolition materials in excess of 25 pounds or over four feet long. Metal or car parts in excess of 20 pounds or over four feet long. Tree trunks or stumps longer than 4 feet and bigger than 12 inches in diameter.
curbside_rules.the_catch: There are specific guidelines that must be followed or we cannot collect bulk trash from your property. Customers will have four (4) collection opportunities each year. Keep pile at least 5 feet away from any fixed objects. Do not place pile on top of water meters. Place on the edge of your property. Don't Include:​ Loose debris and litter, and any ordinary household trash. Loose grass, leaves, weeds, twigs and hedge clippings. Household hazardous waste (HHW), such as antifreeze, pool chemicals, oil, batteries and paint. Community piles – avoid combining piles from multiple house

seo.meta_desc_override: Learn Philadelphia's 2026 mattress disposal rules to avoid $300-$1,000 fines. Discover curbside pickup options and proper disposal methods for residents.

hero_hook: Don't risk a $300-$1,000 fine trying to dispose of your mattress improperly in rainy Philadelphia.

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: The Department of Sanitation will continue to collect up to two (2) large items (non-metal) per household on regularly scheduled trash collection days, including mattresses wrapped in plastic and other compactable furniture.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Philadelphia residents can schedule bulk item pickups for up to four (4) items per appointment. The Department of Sanitation will continue to collect up to two (2) large items (non-metal) per household on regularly scheduled trash collection days, including mattresses wrapped in plastic and other compactable furniture.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Residents can schedule appointments through the Department of Sanitation’s website or by contacting 311. Appointments are limited and will be scheduled on a first-come, first-serve basis.

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Philadelphia averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.

seo.title_override: San Diego Mattress Disposal Guide 2026 - Easy & Eco-Friendly
seo.meta_desc_override: San Diego mattress disposal made easy! Learn rules for 2026. No fines, dry weather tips. Curbside pickup status unclear—check with the City of San Diego for options.

hero_hook: Struggling to figure out how to responsibly dispose of your old mattress in sunny San Diego?
neighborhoods: La Jolla, Pacific Beach, North Park, Hillcrest, Gaslamp Quarter, Little Italy, Ocean Beach, Mission Beach, Clairemont, Mira Mesa, Carmel Valley, University City, Bankers Hill, Golden Hill, Point Loma

drop_off_locations.name: Miramar Landfill
drop_off_locations.address: 5161 Convoy St., San Diego, CA 92111
drop_off_locations.hours: Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. The site is closed on Saturdays and Sundays. The Mattress Collection Site is CLOSED on the following holidays: New Year’s Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day.
drop_off_locations.tipping_fee: Free for mattresses and box springs.
drop_off_locations.notes: Accepts traditional mattresses and box springs. Futon mattresses are also eligible, but must be removed from the frame or base. Futon mattresses that do not detach are not accepted for recycling. Items must not be severely damaged, wet, twisted, frozen, soiled or infested with bedbugs. No drop-off limit. All items accepted for recycling must have been used and discarded in the state of California. Unacceptable items include: Severely damaged, wet, twisted, frozen or soiled mattresses or box springs; mattresses infested with bedbugs; mattress pads or toppers; sleeping bags and cots; pillows, cushions, blankets, sheets and other loose bedding.

competitor_comparison.value_prop: No franchise fees. Just local haulers.

seo.title_override: San Jose Mattress Disposal 2026: Your Complete Guide
seo.meta_desc_override: Avoid a $2,500 fine! Discover San Jose's 2026 mattress disposal rules, including convenient curbside pickup options. Keep San Jose clean and stay compliant.

hero_hook: Don't let an old mattress become a costly problem in San Jose.
neighborhoods: Willow Glen, Rose Garden, Almaden Valley, Evergreen, Cambrian Park, Naglee Park, Japantown, Berryessa, Silver Creek, Santa Teresa, Edenvale, West San Jose, Downtown San Jose, North San Jose, East San Jose

curbside_rules.mattress_specific_rule: See the list of acceptable junk items , such as mattresses, furniture, tires, and more.
curbside_rules.placement_time: Set out your items up to 24 hours before your scheduled appointment. Set out your Junk Pickup items the same way you set out your carts – on the street next to the curb.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Requests may include up to 12 items for pickup.
curbside_rules.the_catch: All items must be generated from your home. Do you have construction and demolition (C&D) material? Hire an authorized hauler for larger clean-out projects and/or Construction & Demolition material.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Visit 311.SanJoseCA.gov , dial 3-1-1, or call (408) 535-3500 to request a junk pickup appointment at no cost. Appointments are scheduled on the same day(s) as your regular recycling and garbage collection. Residents can schedule unlimited junk pickups for free. Residents in homes and mobile home parks can schedule a pickup by calling their recycling collection company directly. Apartment and condominium residents can contact their property managers or GreenTeam of San Jose at (408) 282-4400.

illegal_dumping.citation: Early and/or improper set out may result in the items not being picked up or a citation, as it may be considered illegal dumping.

competitor_comparison.value_prop: No franchise fees. Just local haulers.

seo.title_override: Seattle Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Easy & Legal Options
seo.meta_desc_override: Navigate Seattle mattress disposal rules effortlessly. Avoid fines up to $5,000! Learn about curbside pickup, donation, and recycling options for a smooth process.

hero_hook: Don't let Seattle's notorious rain or a hefty $5,000 fine make mattress disposal a nightmare.
neighborhoods: Ballard, Capitol Hill, Queen Anne, Fremont, West Seattle, Belltown, South Lake Union, Columbia City, Georgetown, Beacon Hill, Phinney Ridge, Ravenna, University District, Wallingford, Pioneer Square

curbside_rules.the_catch: Costs vary by the type of item collected. Charges for special item collections will appear on your combined utility bill. The utility account holder must make the request. Utility Discount Program (UDP) customers can get two free special item pickups per year. Specific costs: No cost for foam blocks and used cooking/motor oil. $5.00 per pick up, per item type for small propane canisters, CFLs, household batteries. $20.00 per pick up for a Special Items box. $30.00 per item for large furniture, appliances, and TVs larger than 2' x 2' x 2'. $38.00 per item for items containing CFCs (e.g., refrigerators/freezers manufactured before 2005). Specific instructions on how to prepare items for collection will be provided when you schedule the pickup.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: To request the collection of large or hard to dispose of items at your home, schedule online or call Seattle Public Utilities Customer Service at (206) 684-3000.

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Seattle averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.

drop_off_locations.address: 1290 NW 20 STREET, Miami, FL
drop_off_locations.hours: MONDAY - FRIDAY 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM SATURDAY: 8:00 AM - 12 Noon CLOSED: Sunday, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. & Christmas Day
drop_off_locations.notes: ONE (1) PROOF OF CITY OF MIAMI RESIDENCY: Florida Driver's license or Florida ID, utility statements for the last 3 months (ex. electricity, cell phone, water or trash compactor bill), a rental agreement, a tax bill or other documents that prove City of Miami residency. A MAXIMUM OF ONE (1) TRIP PER DAY ALLOWED (Each trip is no more than a pickup truck load). WILL NOT ACCEPT THE FOLLOWING: VEHICLES WITH COMMERCIAL MARKINGS, DUMP-TYPE OR PANEL TYPE TRUCKS, COMMERCIAL TRUCKS OR VANS OR MATERIALS FROM COMMERCIAL CONTRACTORS.

curbside_rules.size_limits: Grass clippings, leaves, and small twigs no more than two inches in diameter. Branches and twigs up to four feet in length and no more than four inches in diameter should be bundled and tied securely.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Yard waste collection runs March 31 through December 19 and will be picked up weekly at the curbline with the rest of your solid waste.
